column5: Has any one used this stuff. If so, what are some of the pro's and con's
Tybo that stuff is the CATS BUM you wont be dissapointed just keep in mind layering is the key
Hey Pete. Don't think I want too layer up in the summer. Asking about the heat gear. Not the cold gear. teehee.

The heat gear is good too.  You won't feel as sticky and sweaty as you do when wearing cotton.  Only bad thing about it is it cost about $30+ for each item of clothing... (I have one in loose t-shirt style, which basically became my summer fishing shirt). Also, if it's windy and the boat ride is a bit wet, the shirt dries faster too.  I use a bug jacket on those mosquito days, so I don't know the effect of bugspray on the underarmor material...but I think deet will eat it up... And I've only had the shirt for 1 season, so I can't say anything about the long term durability...  Note: the heat gear is also good in the winter when used as the inner most layer...
what is under armor heat gear?
